justification: Participants provided a Type-2 metacognitive judgment on a 4-point scale representing confidence levels, indicating the appropriateness of their perceptual decisions, as described in the Methods section.

Participants made a Type-3 judgment on a binary scale, assessing their certainty about the appropriateness of their Type-2 metacognitive ratings, supporting higher-order metacognitive processes, as detailed in the Procedure section.
